website_summaries.verdict: This portable photo printer produces quality output, but we wish it ran on batteries. It could stand to be a lot faster, too.
pros: connects directly to cameras, media cards, and external storage devices
cons: No color LCD for previewing or cropping images

customer_reviews.title: Beyond disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in the product. Before even taking the printer out of the box, the box itself looked beat up and areas where picture on the box had been torn or rubbed off. When attempting to use the printer the ink did not distribute like it should on photo paper. Could that be because the ink cartridge expired 09-2006?! So that means this printer sat around for 14 years! I would expect a new product when ordering it now and not something that is 14 years old! Couldn't call Amazon fast enough to request a return and refund!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: My printer arrived sooner than I expected; I was thrilled to connect it and start printing. I had had one of these when they first came out; but after some years and moving around it took some punishment and stopped working. This vendor had one in excellent conditions with all the manuals, registration, cables, and cd to install and get this cute printer up and running. I would purchase from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Moms90

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this seller!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this printer. I had the older model of the PictureMate printer and used for almost 10 years. Loved it. Then purchased this model (from 3rd party). It was defective. Called Epson support and after a couple of hours on the phone and emails it was determined that the printer has been discontinued 12 years ago. The Epson warranty was not valid.. Epson support was very helpful but they do not deal with 3rd party and had to return the printer. Amazon honored the return. Have always been happy with EEpson, therefore I will purchase another model.
customer_reviews.author: mower guy

customer_reviews.title: I would rate it at less than one. It is defective
customer_reviews.text: This printer does not print passport or wallet size photos. I have had it for some time now but has just completed my studio and is ready to use it. I have lost a lot of money purchasing this printer which I was expecting to be be in working condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. It is so handy. My old one quit working do I had to buy this new one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E Woitt

customer_reviews.title: The "Easy Bake Oven" of Photo Printers!
customer_reviews.text: I had this little gem out of the box and up and running within about 10 minutes. So simple, a 6-year-old could use it! I love the compact size, and the quality is incredible. I used up my trial pack of paper in the first sitting, so be sure to order extra! Note: It is important to stick with the Epson paper; I tried it with another brand I already had and the quality was very poor. But what the heck, at $20 for ink AND 100 sheets of paper, who can complain? A Great Buy Overall!
customer_reviews.author: Queen Hippolyta

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: did not work unit usb port and the card port was not recognizing the picture file
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: The print cartridge is a problem
customer_reviews.text: This will only print well with the Epsom print cartridge and they are $$. If you buy any aftermarket or refurbished cartridge you cannot clean the print head and then you will never get a good print again. Avoid all Epson printers for the same reason. AGGGH.
customer_reviews.author: FussyBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a present a while ago. She loved it and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: sg7365

customer_reviews.title: Faded but works
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. It only works plugged into a computer though. The picture quality is not as good as what it would be if you printed the pictures off at the store. They are kind of faded. But this device works effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Brown

customer_reviews.title: Epson PictureMate Personal Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: My son, an IT person, recommended the PictureMate for me because it is simple to use and knows that I cannot use my HP LaserJet printer for quality copies of my photo's. My only negative is that I must use it most of the time or it will dry out and be worthless. I don't think I will be using it that much, but will try.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest L. Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: so i cant say much good for the product  i forgot to mention that i spent a lot of $ having a pro computer tec. helping
customer_reviews.text: I tried to make it print with a Linux Mint system ! it suppled a driver but it still was a no go! so i cant say much good for the product. i have used HP in the past with no problem i would think Epson would make a product that would work with every system. so the printer is in the box it came with for sale very cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Ron priest

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this printer because it arrived broken.
customer_reviews.author: im1crzymama

customer_reviews.title: She and her friends had a great time using it since the pictures were almost HD ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my adult daughter. She and her friends had a great time using it since the pictures were almost HD quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Vendor description was as good as actual printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is better than expected (had to purchase ink cartridge). Vendor stated that printer was a display version and did not include any documentation, no problem downloaded "all" required information from EPSON. Printer is really good, and produces good color pictures. Note: system found Windows 7 (32x) drivers as soon as it was plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Kollar

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my phone.
customer_reviews.text: When i tried to print pictures off of my phone using a usb cable it ruined my phone. My phone no longer charged. It refused to stay on and when it turned off on its own it would not turn back on.
customer_reviews.author: Mckinney's

customer_reviews.title: Be careful what you order and from whom!
customer_reviews.text: This was a total scam, I received a box of cable cords and junk, no printer at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Medina

customer_reviews.title: Epson PictureMate does NOT read all SD camera cards as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am going to return my personal photo printer. I am so sad, but the Epson Picturemate personal photo printer will not read my pictures off my SD camera card ....even after transferring to a compact flash. How do I go about returning this item and receiving my money back? I have a brand new Nikon Cool Pix Camera.
customer_reviews.author: kathy mckinney

customer_reviews.title: I have used the printer once and it worked beautifully! I did have to clean the printer heads ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the printer once and it worked beautifully! I did have to clean the printer heads and test print several times but it is a used machine and probably sat unused for awhile so that was understandable. Customer service was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH

customer_reviews.title: purchased picturemate printer
customer_reviews.text: i had purchased a picturemate printer last month.the description was written up exactly as it was. i am very happy to have gotten it,and willstart using it after the holiday season to do all my pictures. it was very reasonable priced also.
customer_reviews.author: bjstruch

customer_reviews.title: did not work correctly
customer_reviews.text: unit was rated very good-but i found out that it would not work with the computer even after i put in the program cd that i had.. even with picture card it did not produce good pictures. i used my cartridge from my other picturemate that was working properly so i know it was not the cartridge that was the cause of poor pictures i wil not buy another picturemate(and i do need another)unless i see a printout of the nozzle pattern.
customer_reviews.author: earl

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer quality is awesome. It takes maybe 1 minute to print a full 4x6 picture. It looks better than CVS and you can take a picture and have it in a frame in 5 minutes. I was tired of builing up my flasncard with 100 pictures then dreading sorting through them and uploading them online to ofoto or bringing the card into the drugstore that I never did it. Now when I have a great picture or I want Grandma to have a picture of the kids it is very easy to do. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A Little Dynamo
customer_reviews.text: I now have no excuse not to take pictures. The Epson Picture Mate is easy to use and the finished product is as good as or better than any photo lab. The one complaint that I hear and read about is the lack of a monitor. Since I review most of my pictures in the camera's monitor (Nikon coolpix 995) or enhance them with my computer, I hardly miss the monitor at all. If it prints too slowly for anyone, I suggest that you press the print button and go about your business. When you return, you wil have some of the finest quality (use the epson paper) longest lasting prints that you can obtain anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Howard C

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble getting it to print clearly
customer_reviews.text: Had to clean the print heads a lot before I could get a good print out of it. Love it now but it used most of the ink cartridge to get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: very poor
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a very out of date model but since I loved my other I was thrilled to still be able to get it at all. I paid $119. It arrived in a beat up box with a $24.99 sticker on it, and it did not work. When I arranged to send it back I was issued a very small amount of money to return the item, which did not remotely cover the cost of the shipping I paid to get it returned. All in all a bad purchase experience.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Epson picturemate
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent product. The print quality is stellar and the picturemate is very easy to use. The only draw back thus far is the slow speed. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda German

customer_reviews.title: One STAR
customer_reviews.text: Is for the Vendor a third party and not Amazon. Advertised as in working order and ready to go. Not so. Ink cartridge dated 10.2007. I had to spend another $32.00 at Best Buy for a cartridge. If I had not needed it by Tues 4.25.14, I would have sent it back. I am becoming more and more suspicious of third party vendors. It seems to me most hype their products and do not deliver the goods.
customer_reviews.author: chaswes5

customer_reviews.title: The Epson PictureMate Personal Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it to replace the one my Rotary Club currently has. We use it to print pictures of our guest speakers which is put in a picture frame as a way of expressing our appreciation to them for speaking to us. We also use it at social events to give pictures to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hovsepian

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from this vendor
customer_reviews.text: This Product was advertised as if it were ready to use. I set it up and tried to use it but the paper feeder refused to feed the paper. I needed the Power Cord so I consider that I paid $40+ just to get the power cord. VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: Robbie 1955

customer_reviews.title: best photo printer
customer_reviews.text: We love this photo printer. Pictures come out clear. They look like they've been done professionally done. Only thing we do not like is you can only print 4x6 photos.
customer_reviews.author: kris

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This printer DID not come with paper as it said it did.... are you going to ship It?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing printer
customer_reviews.text: love it, none is better, to keep printer running, print a page a week and it will not clog, i have six of them. buy it.
customer_reviews.author: B. O. S. Bhagwandin

customer_reviews.title: Item not as described
customer_reviews.text: The item was suppose to be new, however it was obviously used. The box was demolished, ink cartridge was dried up, and the paper was already used (gone). The printer was dated from 2005 and the used ink cartridge 2006. We tried purchasing a new ink cartridge from Epson, but unfortunately not even that worked. The item was so old that it wouldn't recognize a modern day memory card. Nonetheless, the item has been returned.
customer_reviews.author: kerv22

customer_reviews.title: Epson PictureMate Phot Printer
customer_reviews.text: This product was just as it said it was. We are very pleased with it.Also it came in a timely manner for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Madquilter

customer_reviews.title: epson picturemate personal potto  printer
customer_reviews.text: It was just as good as the one I have on hand. I would tell my frineds about tis web site chuck
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this... according to the details it said like new. When I got it I ordered the ink & paper so I can pint up my pics... when I tryed loading my pics onto it it would not read my memory card, then I tryed hooking up my computer to it so I can send the pics that way it still didn't work. Very very very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: maria v  torres "vicky"

customer_reviews.title: Funnest 183 bucks I ever spent, that was with the additional
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest, funnest way to make some pictures I have ever encountered...virtually idiot proof
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Knadler

customer_reviews.title: Espson PictureMate Printer
customer_reviews.text: PictureMate generally does a good job. Instruction booklet leaves a lot to the desired!!! Contact with manufacturer near worthless. Plan to use up much time/materials to finally figure out all the many features built into this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Fraud!!!
customer_reviews.text: Total junk! Seller misrepresented the product. Product claimed to be refurbished but was clearly just someone's used piece of junk. Unit has not successfully printed one picture after weeks of trying! DO NOT buy from this seller as they clearly are taking advantage of their customers. USB port won't work, the SD Card port won't work, just problem after problem with a "supposedly" refurbished unit. I spend thousands of dollars a year on Amazon and this is the worst purchase by far. I feel totally scammed!!
customer_reviews.author: Trenton W Terry

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: This printer absolutely did NOT meet my expectations. It was supposed to be a WORKING printer, however, IT DOES NOT WORK! I've contacted the seller but NO RESPONSE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kecia L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Photo smart
customer_reviews.text: I could not get the product to make pictures frrom the camera card. The seller and I worked out an arrangement since the other features worked. He was reasonable on this.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lingle

customer_reviews.title: RIPPED OFF
customer_reviews.text: I was ripped off. This printer was listed as NEW but arrived USED AND BROKEN, I did what AMOZON told me too do. I sent item back and Never got my money.
customer_reviews.author: jody52770

customer_reviews.title: Blinded
customer_reviews.text: The worst ever, I'll never buy anything used again without a visual . There was no power cord inside the box so I never got to see if it worked! It was a ink cartridge taped to the printer, so was tape all around it stuck to the printer. Wasn't the best choice I made. Definitely buyers remorse. I returned it with no problems and received a full refund. I was very satisfied with that . Then I bought a new one
customer_reviews.author: Klassikat

customer_reviews.title: You Sent a Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: It was suppose to be New Box zall beat up , No instruction CD didn't work I gave it to a friend since I couldn'tget my money back
customer_reviews.author: Bigfish

product_meta.title: Epson PictureMate Personal Photo Printer
product_meta.description:
The PictureMate from Epson is a photo printer designed to produce lab-quality prints from the comfort of your own home. With its simple one-touch printing, 5,760 x 1,440 maximum dpi resolution, and convenient PictureMate Print Packs, this printer is a remarkable combination of quality, ease of use, and affordability. The PictureMate prints JPEG or TIFF photos from any USB digital camera and is compatible with both Mac and PC operating platforms. A wide variety of card types are also accepted, including CF Type I and II, SmartMedia, Sony Memory Stick/MemoryStick PRO, Duo (requires adapter), SD, MMC, and xD-Picture.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description The PictureMate from Epson is a photo printer designed to produce lab-quality prints from the comfort of your own home. With its simple one-touch printing, 5,760 x 1,440 maximum dpi resolution, and convenient PictureMate Print Packs, this printer is a remarkable combination of quality, ease of use, and affordability. 

Wide Compatibility
Slots for digital camera memory cards in several formats  The PictureMate prints JPEG or TIFF photos from any USB digital camera and is compatible with both Mac and PC operating platforms. A wide variety of card types are also accepted, including CF Type I and II, SmartMedia, Sony Memory Stick/MemoryStick PRO, Duo (requires adapter), SD, MMC, and xD-Picture. 

 The printer initially comes with a starter photo cartridge and 20 sheets of paper. Thereafter, you'll purchase PictureMate Print Packs, which contain 100 sheets of paper and a photo ink cartridge with an approximate 100-page yield. 

 

Prints That Last and Stay Beautiful
Original print (left), then a spill-and-wipe test on leading glossy and semi-gloss papers (two middle) and on PictureMate (right)  The prints resist water, smudging, and most notably fading. Epson estimates an archival lifetime of up to 200 years if the photos are kept in a relatively dark place (such as a photo album) or up to 100 years in a frame (see Epson's web site for details). True borderless printing (or bordered, if you prefer) combined with sturdy stock help to give your prints a professional look and feel. A cartridge level indicator lets you know how much ink you have left. 

 

Easy Operation
Simple menus and one-touch buttons make printing a snap!  Other features include a multiple print function that lets you make up to 100 copies of a single picture. A Save Photo button lets you back up digital files directly to an external CD-R, Zip drive, or USB Thumb drive. 

 The small 10-by-6-inch footprint fits neatly onto your desk or countertop, and the convenient handle provides true portability. An optional Bluetooth adapter lets you print wirelessly from Bluetooth enabled devices. The PictureMate is backed by a one-year limited warranty.

 What's in the Box
PictureMate Personal Photo Lab, power cord, starter PictureMate photo cartridge, 20 sheets of PictureMate Photo Paper, CD-ROM, user manuals; Epson Software Film Factory 3.05 (PC and Macintosh compatible, P.I.M. and Exif Print-enabled); USB cable not included 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
With quick, one-touch printing, PictureMate is like having a personal photo lab in the comfort of your own home. At about 29 cents per print, printing is as affordable as the lab, and about half the cost of other 4-by-6-inch dedicated photo printers, and PictureMate photos will last longer than all the alternatives available today–about two to four times longer than photo lab prints. Trust your photos to PictureMate–designed to fit your schedule, fit your needs, fit your life.

 Features: 

 * Easy one-touch printing for lab-quality glossy borderless 4-by-6-inch photos 
 * Ideal companion for any digital camera–no computer required 
 * Water and fade-resistant photos–up to 100 years when displayed in a glass frame, up to 200 years in a photo album 
 * Convenient and affordable PictureMate Print Pack 
 * Compatible with Windows and Macintosh computers 

 Brilliant Lab Quality
What if you could print photos that look as good as the photo lab right in the comfort and safety of your own home? Think that's impossible? Not anymore. PictureMate delivers stunning photos just like those from a photo lab, bringing you the brilliance of everyday moments captured by your digital camera.

 With its unique six-color pigment technology and industry-leading resolution, PictureMate's true-to-life photos will truly amaze you with rich, vibrant colors and beautiful skin tones. It's all you expect from a photo lab print, in a product that fits your life.

 Ease of Use
Digital photography doesn't have to be difficult. In fact, with PictureMate, it couldn't be easier. With just one touch of a button, you can print stacks of beautiful photos. It's easy to use, easy to own, and fully compatible with all popular camera memory cards and PictBridge cameras.

 It's simple and versatile. You can print your photos in black-and-white or sepia tones, with classic borders, borderless, or wallet sizes. You can even crop and resize your photos. Do all this without ever turning on your PC.

 The PictureMate Print Pack includes a Photo Cartridge and 100 sheets of PictureMate 4-by-6-inch photo paper conveniently packaged together in one box. PictureMate is the perfect accessory for your digital camera. Just snap, print, and enjoy!

 Long Lasting Results
Whether in an album, a frame, or a shoebox, we all want our photos to last. But digital photos are lost every day to hard drive crashes and other mishaps. Epson created PictureMate to help you preserve your memories so even your great-grandkids could enjoy photos of your most loyal companions.

 When displayed, PictureMate photos resist fading as much as two to four times longer than the leading photo lab brands, and about four to 20 times longer than other dedicated 4-by-6-inch photo printers. Made to share for generations--even centuries, PictureMate photos last approximately 200 years in a photo album and up to 100 years when displayed in a glass frame. They are also water- and smudge-resistant for worry-free handling. (See Wilhelm-research.com for test conditions. Actual print stability will vary according to image and storage or display conditions. Epson does not guarantee the longevity of prints.)

 Affordable 29-Cent Prints
For the first time ever, you can print 4-by-6-inch photos at home for the same price as some of the most affordable photo labs. PictureMate photos are also less expensive than most kiosks and online services, and about half the cost of other 4-by-6 photo printers. At around 29 cents a photo, you can finally print to your heart's content. (Actual yields and cost will vary based on images, color balance, environmental conditions, and frequency of use.)

See more
